instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 S0 state but no power
threads.message:
Clean board nothing visible at all, came in before but we could not replicate problem and gave it back to customer, now it came back and finally it is not starting up.

PPBUS_G3H is 8.56v 
PP5V_S0 is 5.1v

But no power

threads.title: 820-3437 S0 state but no power
threads.message:
"came in before but we could not replicate problem"
Which was that problem reported by client?

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors.
Try known good BIOS.

threads.title: 820-3437 S0 state but no power
threads.message: Looks like this board received some heat near or on the CPU, going back to customer now.
